label: 兵衛府
対訳語: Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Divided into the Left (Sahyōefu) and Right Divisions (Uhyōefu).  One pair of the Headquarters of the Guards (Efu), being in charge of patrolling the middle inclosure of the palace grounds, i.e., the outer inclosure of the Imperial Palace (Dairi), namely, from oustide the San'yō-mon and the Ommei-mon　to the Sakuhei-mon and the Kenrei-mon.  Its guards were called the Middle Palace Guards (Hyōe).  Accompanied the Sovereign (Tennō) when he paid imperial visits (gyōkō) outside the Imperial Palace.  [左兵衛府、右兵衛府、衛府、内裏、山陽門、陰明門、朔平門、建礼門、兵衛、天皇、行幸]
